question.title: Was the person asking the questions a professionally trained enumerator?
Was the person asking the questions a potential friend or neighbour?
What the person collecting the questions the same gender as the respondent?
Was the person asking the questions of a higher status than the respondent, lower status than the respondent or same status?

options.title: Person asking question was usually higher status
Person asking question was usually same status
Person asking question was usually lower status

question.title: Who was present during the data collection other than the respondent?

options.title: Only the respondent and enumerator were present
Only the respondent, the enumerator, and those the respondent requested were present
Respondents were selected using a scientific randomization process
Respondents were selected using a modified version of a scientific randomization process
Respondents were selected using partly a scientific randomization process and partly convenience
Respondents were selected randomly in the field by the data collectors
Respondents were selected based on convenience
Respondents were selected because they are part of a specific group

question.title: Were selected respondents followed-up with repeatedly until they answered?
Were respondents selected based on the data collector’s choices?
Were respondents selected based on the data collector’s choices?

section: Who did not answer the questions

question.title: Does the data include a record of respondents who declined to participate?
Were groups of people intentionally not included?

options.title: For example, those living in institutions or those living in jail; or those not home at the time of data collection
No one was intentionally not included

question.title: What groups of people were accidentally not included?

options.title: People who were not home or available at the time of data collection were accidentally not included
Other people were accidentally not included
No one was excluded from the survey by accident

question.title: In what format was the gender question asked?
How was the household status question asked?

options.title: One question. Closed, on who is the head of the household
Enumerator or other external person decided who was head of household

question.title: How was the marriage/partnership question asked?

options.title: One question on relationship status, closed ended question.
Several questions on relationship status asked, closed ended.
Open ended question about relationship status asked

question.title: How was the work question asked?

options.title: One question asked only about primary work
Several questions asked only about primary work
Several questions asked about both primary and secondary work

question.title: Were any questions were answered by the enumerator rather than directly by the respondents

options.title: Yes, one questions was answered by the enumerators only
Yes, several questions were answered by the enumerators only
No questions were answered only by the enumerators

question.title: Do the skip patterns used introduce potential bias?

questions.question: Where was the data collected?
Who has access to the final data?
options: Only the data collection organization has access to the data
The data collection organization and the data respondents have access to the data
The data collection organization and several other organizations have access to the data
The data collection organization and the data respondents and several other organizations have access to the data
The public has access to the data

questions.question: Is the place where the data was collected a place that raises or diminishes the respondent’s status?
options: Location that lowers the respondent’s status

questions.question: What tools/technology was used to collect the data?
How were the options coded?
options: Dataset contains options that have been coded by others

questions.question: What incentivization was offered for data collection?
options: No external incentive was offered to data responders
Data responders were given financial payment (cash or money transfer) for participation
Data responders were given non-financial resources (like cell phone minutes or a gift card) for participation
Data responders were given access to information for participation
Data responders were given access to services for participation

questions.question: What level of ownership are the data producers being given?
options: Respondents are given full access to the entire dataset
Respondents are given full access to their data but cannot make change
Respondents are given full access to their data with possibility to change or remove it
Respondents are given no access to any part of the data

questions.question: What type of results are given to the data respondents?
options: Respondents are given their personal results from the survey
Respondents are given their personal results and the overall results from the survey
Respondents are given only the overall results from the survey
Respondents are given no access to data or results

questions.question: Was any part of this data taken from administrative databases?
What is the primary data collection purpose?
options: User experience or service design analysis

questions.question: What is the secondary data collection purpose?
options: User experience or service design analysis

questions.question: Is there an economic advantage (to data collectors) to the numbers skewing in a particular direction?
Is there an political advantage (to data collectors) to the numbers skewing in a particular direction?
Is there an personal advantage (to data collectors) to the numbers skewing in a particular direction?
Is there an economic advantage (to respondents) to the numbers skewing in a particular direction?
Is there an political advantage (to respondents) to the numbers skewing in a particular direction?
Is there an personal advantage (to respondents) to the numbers skewing in a particular direction?
Is this data collected in connection with eligibility for a benefit?
Is this data collected with a blinding process?
Is this data collected with informed consent?
Has the data been cleaned?
Have anomalies or outliers been accounted for or removed?
Has missing data been deleted?
options: Yes, questions with lots of missing data were deleted
Yes, any respondent without totally complete data was deleted
